intro: Heterostylus, commonly known as the African daisy, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers with ray florets and disc florets. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. Its botanical features include a woody base and a rosette of leaves. Heterostylus is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
